chargeHist.descr: Robbery with Use of Force as repeater

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. LISOWSKI was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with the sentence imposed on 14 CF 474.
The Court finds the defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program after he has served 2.5 years of his sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: To Book World in Manitowoc, WI.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.

Defendant is to have one doctor to prescribe medication and have one pharmacist.

No contact with BP Gas Station in Manitowoc, Book World in Manitowoc, Mobil Gas Station in Manitowoc, El Alamo in Manitowoc and Family Pantry (Marathon Gas Station) in Manitowoc.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
The State files an Amended Information which amends count 2 to robbery with threat of force, contrary to Section 943.32(1)(b) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge in count 2.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1, 3, 4, 5 and 6.  Motion granted.
Presentence Invesigation ordered.  PSI is due to the court by 11-13-15.
Sentencing is set for 11-20-15 at 2:30 p.m.
The Court, on its own motion, revokes bail.  State to draft the order.
The Court orders the defendant to submit to a DNA sample at this time.

George Pappas, through Public Defender.

Petition and Order to Withdraw as Counsel of Record.

Attorney Larson moves to withdraw as counsel.  She has discovered a conflict with theses cases.
The Court has already signed the appropriate orders.
Status conference is set for 06-26-15 at 10:30 a.m.

Minutes.
RE:  Possess Heroin, on 10-13-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of robbery-use of force, 2 counts theft, attempted theft, possess heroin and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-20-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash with the conditions that he maintain absolute sobriety and have no contact with the Mobil Gas Station at 3930 Calumet Avenue; Book World at 907 S. 8th Street; BP Gas Station at 2914 Calumet Avenue; El Alamo at 2205 Marshall Street; Family Pantry (Marathon Gas Station) on Washington Street; and with Cindel Morreau.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
